title: Ben Youngs breaks Jonny Wilkinson record during England clash with Argentina
text:
Ben Youngs has become the most-capped England back ever (Picture: AP)

Ben Youngs could not possibly have dreamed, watching Jonny Wilkinson kick England to Rugby World Cup glory as a 14-year-old back in 2003, that he might match the fly-half in any career statistic.

But that is exactly what Youngs did when Argentina kicked the game off in their Pool C clash with England.

The scrum-half made his England debut back in 2010 and has since become a senior member of the side, a constant through changing regimes.

The Leicester Tiger won his 92nd cap today to become England’s most-capped back of all-time.

Youngs’ Leicester team-mate Dan Cole also started the week on 91 caps, the same count as the legendary Wilkinson, but he was named as a replacement to tick over to 92 and move Wilkinson down to fifth in the all-time list.

Advertisement

Advertisement

But those ahead of Cole, Jason Leonard and Dylan Hartley, are both forwards, meaning Youngs is the one who takes Wilkinson’s record as a fellow back.

‘Jonny’s an icon of the game so this is pretty cool,’ Youngs said ahead of the game.

‘I remember making my first start for England and Jonny was also involved.

Jonny Wilkinson and Ben Youngs did play together for England (Picture: Getty)

‘But I’m in this World Cup bubble at the moment and while these type of accolades are nice, I had no idea.

‘Maybe it is something I will sit down and think about after the World Cup.

‘It really does go quickly, but it’s been an enjoyable ride.

‘When you first start out with England, you’re not really sure what’s going on.

‘Then you get older and understand what gets you there, how you do it – and how you then sustain it.

‘Getting there is almost the easy bit. The hard bit is staying there and being consistent.’
